devdoc.details: Contract for streaming token payments for set periods of time

params.receiver: The address that has paid balances
The address that has paid balances
The address that has paid balances
The address that has paid balances

claimAllAvailableTokens(uint256[]).details: Errors if no tokens are claimableIt is advised receivers check they are entitled to claim via `claimableBalance` before calling this

params.payments: The payment ids for available token balances

claimAvailableTokenAmounts(uint256[],uin.details: Errors if token amounts provided are > claimable amountsIt is advised receivers check they are entitled to claim via `claimableBalance` before calling this

params.amounts: The amount of each available token to claim
params.payments: The payment ids for available token balances

claimableBalance(uint256).details: Returns 0 if cliff duration has not ended

returns._0: The amount that can be claimed

params.amount: The amount of tokens being paid
params.payer: The account that is paymenting tokens
params.receiver: The account that will be able to retrieve available tokens
params.startTime: The unix timestamp when the payment period will start

createPaymentWithPermit(address,address,.details: It is up to the frontend developer to ensure the token implements permit - otherwise this will fail

params.amount: The amount of tokens being paid
params.cliffDurationInDays: The payment cliff duration in days
params.deadline: The time at which to expire the signature
params.payer: The account that is paymenting tokens
params.r: Half of the ECDSA signature pair
params.receiver: The account that will be able to retrieve available tokens
params.s: Half of the ECDSA signature pair
params.startTime: The unix timestamp when the payment period will start
params.v: The recovery byte of the signature

params.paymentId: The payment id for a payment
params.stopTime: Timestamp to stop payment, if 0 use current block.timestamp

params.receiver: The address that has available balances

returns.balance: the total active balance of `token` for `receiver`

SECONDS_PER_DAY.details: Used to translate payment periods specified in days to seconds

devdoc.title: Payments

PaymentCreated(address,address,address,u.notice: Event emitted when a new payment is created

TokensClaimed(address,address,uint256,ui.notice: Event emitted when tokens are claimed by a receiver from an available balance

activePaymentBalances(address).notice: Get all active token payment balances for receiver

activePaymentIds(address).notice: Get all active token payment ids for receiver

activePayments(address).notice: Get all active token payments for receiver

allActivePaymentBalances().notice: Get all active token payment balances

allActivePaymentIds().notice: Get all active token payment ids

allPayments(address).notice: Get all token payments for receiver

claimAllAvailableTokens(uint256[]).notice: Allows receiver to claim all of their available tokens for a set of payments

claimAvailableTokenAmounts(uint256[],uin.notice: Allows receiver to claim a portion of their available tokens for a given payment

claimableBalance(uint256).notice: Get claimable balance for a given payment id

createPayment(address,address,address,ui.notice: Create payment, optionally providing voting power

createPaymentWithPermit(address,address,.notice: Create payment, using permit for approval

paymentBalance(uint256).notice: Get payment balance for a given payment id

paymentIds(address,uint256).notice: Mapping of address to payment id

stopPayment(uint256,uint48).notice: Allows payer or receiver to stop existing payments for a given paymentId

tokenPayments(uint256).notice: Mapping of payment id > token payments
